epic_description: Provide detailed analytics on orders, revenue, customer activity, and reviews for informed decision-making.

user_stories.title: Order Analytics Dashboard
user_stories.description: As a business owner, I want a dashboard displaying key order metrics (total orders, average order value, order fulfillment rate) so I can quickly assess overall order performance.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as an administrator, When I navigate to the analytics dashboard, Then I should see a panel displaying total orders for the selected period.
Given I am logged in as an administrator, When I navigate to the analytics dashboard, Then I should see a panel displaying the average order value for the selected period.

Given I am logged in as an administrator, When I navigate to the analytics dashboard, Then I should see a panel displaying the order fulfillment rate (percentage of orders shipped within the defined SLA) for the selected period.

user_stories.title: Revenue Analytics Report
user_stories.description: As a finance manager, I want a report showing revenue trends (total revenue, revenue by product category, revenue by region) so I can understand revenue performance and identify growth opportunities.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as a finance manager, When I generate a revenue report for the last quarter, Then I should see the total revenue generated during that quarter.
Given I am logged in as a finance manager, When I generate a revenue report, Then I should be able to filter the report by product category and see revenue breakdowns for each category.
Given I am logged in as a finance manager, When I generate a revenue report, Then I should be able to filter the report by region and see revenue breakdowns for each region.

user_stories.title: Customer Activity Report
user_stories.description: As a marketing manager, I want a report tracking customer activity (new customers, active customers, customer churn rate) so I can measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and identify areas for customer retention efforts.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as a marketing manager, When I generate a customer activity report for the last month, Then I should see the number of new customers acquired during that month.

Given I am logged in as a marketing manager, When I generate a customer activity report, Then I should see the number of active customers (defined as customers who made a purchase or logged in) during the selected period.

Given I am logged in as a marketing manager, When I generate a customer activity report, Then I should see the customer churn rate (percentage of customers who stopped using the service) during the selected period.

user_stories.title: Review and Rating Analytics
user_stories.description: As a product manager, I want to see aggregated customer reviews and ratings for products so I can understand customer sentiment and identify product improvements.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as a product manager, When I navigate to a product details page, Then I should see the average customer rating for that product.
Given I am logged in as a product manager, When I navigate to a product details page, Then I should see a summary of customer reviews, including positive and negative feedback.
Given I am logged in as a product manager, When I navigate to the review section, I should be able to filter reviews by rating (e.g., show only 5-star reviews).

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as an administrator.
steps: Select a date range (e.g., last 7 days).
test_cases.expected_results: The total orders panel should display the correct total number of orders placed within the selected date range.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as an administrator.
steps: Select a date range (e.g., last month).
test_cases.expected_results: The average order value panel should display the correct average value of orders placed within the selected date range.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a finance manager.
steps: Select a date range (e.g., last quarter).
test_cases.expected_results: The report should display the total revenue generated during the selected quarter.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a finance manager.
steps: Select a date range (e.g., last year).
Filter by a specific product category (e.g., 'Electronics').
test_cases.expected_results: The report should display the total revenue generated by the 'Electronics' product category during the selected year.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a marketing manager.
steps: Navigate to the Customer Activity Report.
Select a date range (e.g., last 30 days).
test_cases.expected_results: The report should display the correct number of new customers acquired within the last 30 days.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a marketing manager.
steps: Navigate to the Customer Activity Report.
Select a date range (e.g., last quarter).
test_cases.expected_results: The report should display the number of active customers within the selected quarter based on the criteria for active user activity (e.g. Logged in, or placed an order).

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a product manager.
steps: Navigate to the details page for a specific product (e.g., 'Product A').
test_cases.expected_results: The average customer rating for 'Product A' should be displayed correctly.

test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in as a product manager.
steps: Navigate to the details page for a specific product (e.g., 'Product B').
test_cases.expected_results: A summary of customer reviews should be displayed, including an indicator for number of positive (4 and 5-star) and negative (1 and 2-star) reviews.
